newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: New Star limit-up on takeover defence.
newsitem.headline: New Star limit-up on takeover defence.

text.p: Shares of South Korea's New Star, a maker of garments, went limit-up in Friday's early trading on its move to thwart a takeover bid by a Seoul-based hotel, brokers said.
New Star rose 4,900 won to its daily limit of 66,500.
The company said it would buy back five percent of its own common shares between April 21 and July 20 to defend against a takeover bid by Savoy Hotel.
On Wednesday, the Korea Stock Exchange said Savoy had bought 11.11 percent of New Star's outstanding shares in the open market on April 9-10, raising its stake in the garment company to 24.7 percent.
The hotel said it planned to increase the stake to 51 percent to take over New Star's management.
